ul.li1: 1Children, listen to the instruction of a father,
ul.li2: and be attentive in order to know insight.
ul.li1: 2For I have given you good instruction;
ul.li2: do not forsake my teaching.
ul.li1: 3When I was a son to my father,
ul.li2: tender and alone before my mother,
ul.li1: 4he taught me and said to me,
ul.li2: “May your heart hold fast to my words;
guard my commandments and live.
ul.li1: 5Get wisdom and insight;
ul.li2: do not forget and do not turn from the sayings of my mouth.
ul.li1: 6Do not forsake her—then she will guard you;
ul.li2: love her and she will keep you.
ul.li1: 7The beginning of wisdom: Get wisdom!
ul.li2: With all that is in your possession, gain insight.
ul.li1: 8Cherish her and she will exalt you;
ul.li2: she will honor you if you embrace her.
ul.li1: 9She will give a garland for your head;
ul.li2: she shall bestow a crown of glory upon you.”

ul.li1: 10Listen, my child, take my sayings,
ul.li2: and the years of your life shall be great.
ul.li1: 11In the way of wisdom I have instructed you;
ul.li2: I have led you in the path of uprightness.
ul.li1: 12When you walk,Literally “In your walking” your step will not be hampered,
ul.li2: and if you run, you will not stumble.
ul.li1: 13Seize the instruction! Do not let go!
ul.li2: Guard her, for she is your life.
ul.li1: 14In the path of the wicked do not go;
ul.li2: do not walk in the way of those who do evil.
ul.li1: 15Avoid it; do not transgress it;
ul.li2: turn away from it and pass by.
ul.li1: 16For they will not sleep if they have not done wrong,
ul.li2: and they are robbed of their sleep if they do not cause stumbling.
ul.li1: 17For they ate the bread of wickedness,
ul.li2: and they drank the wine of violence.
ul.li1: 18But the path of the righteous ones is like the light of dawn,
ul.li2: leading and shining until the day is full.Literally “is correct”
ul.li1: 19The way of the wicked ones is like deep darkness;
ul.li2: they do not know what they stumble over.

ul.li1: 20My child, be attentive to my words;
ul.li2: to my sayings incline your ear.
ul.li1: 21May they not escape from your sight;Literally “eyes”
ul.li2: keep them in the midst of your heart.
ul.li1: 22For they are life to those who find them
ul.li2: and healing to the entire body.Literally “for all his flesh”
ul.li1: 23With all vigilance, keep your heart,
ul.li2: for from it comes the sourceOr “extremity” of life.
ul.li1: 24Remove from yourself deceitful speech,Literally “crookedness of mouth”
ul.li2: and abolish devious talkLiterally “deviousness of lips” from yourself.
ul.li1: 25May your eyes look forwardOr “opposite”
ul.li2: and your gaze be straight before you.
ul.li1: 26May the path of your foot be balanced
ul.li2: and all your ways be sure.
ul.li1: 27Do not swerve right or left;
ul.li2: remove your foot from evil.
